case_study.name: Case Study (CS)
case_study.description: A case study (Written Assessment) consists of scenarios that allow an assessment of the candidate's mastery of abilities. The assessor can collect process evidence to assess the candidate's competencies against the learning outcomes. It allows consistent interpretation of evidence and reliable assessment outcomes.
case_study.focus: This case study assessment focuses on providing authentic evidence of candidates' ability to analyze security risks and propose appropriate solutions in various scenarios.

evidence.LO1: Candidates will submit a report detailing their application of risk identification techniques to detect potential security threats.
evidence.LO2: Candidates will provide a written analysis of how organizational procedures are followed to identify risks, including surveillance and inappropriate behavior.
evidence.LO3: Candidates will submit a detailed analysis of suspicious situations, relating them to prior experiences to identify potential threats.
evidence.LO4: Candidates will submit a report outlining their collaboration with security teams to assess risks using established methods of risk analysis.

submission: Candidates will submit their case study reports and any additional supporting documents to the assessors electronically via the designated learning management system.
case_study.retention_period: All submitted case study reports and accompanying documentation will be retained for 3 years to ensure compliance with institutional policies and for auditing purposes.

oral_questioning.name: Oral Questioning (OQ)
oral_questioning.description: Oral Questioning assessments allow candidates to demonstrate their understanding of concepts through verbal responses, focusing on the practical application of security risk analysis.

evidence.LO1: Candidates will verbally explain how they would apply risk identification techniques in a given scenario.
evidence.LO2: Candidates will verbally describe the organizational procedures for identifying security risks.
evidence.LO3: Candidates will verbally analyze a situation to identify suspicious activities based on prior experiences.
evidence.LO4: Candidates will verbally discuss how they would collaborate with security teams to assess risks.

submission: Candidates will verbally respond to assessors during a structured questioning session.
oral_questioning.retention_period: All oral questioning recordings and assessment notes will be retained for 2 years for compliance and auditing.
